meanings.definition: To establish a connection or link again.
meanings.sent1: I need to relink my phone to the Wi-Fi network.
meanings.sent2: After the power outage, I had to relink all the devices to the internet.
meanings.sent3: Trying to relink my headphones to my phone felt like solving a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to relink the broken pieces of his heart.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to relink the evidence to solve the case.

meanings.definition: To provide a new link or connection.
meanings.sent1: The website will relink you to the updated page automatically.
meanings.sent2: I will relink the documents for easier access.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to relink the rings in a surprising way.
meanings.sent4: His words were able to relink the past to the present.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes seemed to relink the colors in a harmonious blend.

meanings.definition: To restore a broken link or connection.
meanings.sent1: I had to relink the chain that had come loose from the swing.
meanings.sent2: The IT technician will relink the network cables to fix the issue.
meanings.sent3: The repairman had to relink the wires to get the electricity back on.
meanings.sent4: Her apology helped to relink the friendship that had been strained.
meanings.sent5: The bridge was designed to relink the two sides of the river.
